text: Philippe Contamine (7 May 1932 – 26 January 2022) was a French historian. His works focused on the Middle Ages. Contamine was a president of the Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-Lettres, the Société de l'histoire de France, and the Societé des Antiquaires de France. He taught at the Université de Nancy, the Université de Paris X at Nanterre and Université de Paris IV (Paris- Sorbonne). He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. Contamine died on 26 January 2022 in Paris, at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2022 deaths Category:French historians Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Philippe Contamine
